programme.desc: Exploring the tragic murder of four teenage girls at an "I Can't Believe It's Yogurt" shop on December 6, 1991 in Austin, TX; chronicling the immense trauma left by the crime and details the maze of the investigation.

programme.title: The Front Room
programme.desc: Everything goes to hell for newly pregnant Belinda after her mother-in-law moves in. As the diabolical guest tries to get her claws on the child, Belinda must draw the line somewhere.

programme.title: Insidious
programme.desc: A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child in a realm called The Further.

programme.title: The Gilded Age
programme.desc: A wide-eyed young scion of a conservative family embarks on a mission to infiltrate the wealthy neighboring clan dominated by ruthless railroad tycoon George Russell, his rakish son, Larry, and his ambitious wife, Bertha.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Two criminals (Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox) disguise themselves as St. Nick and an elf to rob stores at Christmastime.

programme.title: Bad Santa 2
programme.desc: Fueled by cheap whiskey and greed, a foulmouthed criminal (Billy Bob Thornton), his mean mother (Kathy Bates) and their angry sidekick (Tony Cox) conspire to bilk a Chicago charity on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Shadows
programme.desc: A high school student exploring her independence on homecoming night is disrupted by her older brother and the shadows of their past.

programme.title: Erik Rivera: Super White
programme.desc: Comic Erik Rivera jokes on "levels of whiteness," gross babies, the pleasure of Whole Foods, disappointing one's mother when one's children don't speak Spanish, and why it's OK to play favorites with one's children.

programme.title: Jerry Garcia: It's Not My Weekend
programme.desc: Rising comedian and single father Jerry Garcia makes fun of himself, his parenting style, and his dating life.

programme.title: Live: Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: The comic brings her unique blend of honesty and unapologetic sense of humor to a performance at the historic Apollo Theater in New York.

programme.title: James Acaster: Hecklers Welcome
programme.desc: James Acaster gives up control of his set and embraces audience participation as he explores his complex relationship with stand-up.

programme.title: The Last Circus
programme.desc: A twisted love triangle develops among a Spanish clown (Carlos Areces), his cruel rival (Antonio de la Torre) and the rival's abused -- but lustful -- wife (Carolina Bang).

programme.title: Life After
programme.desc: A single mother and Indian immigrant travels to New York City to clear out her daughter's apartment.

programme.title: Real Time with Bill Maher: Anniversary Special
programme.desc: Bill Maher takes a pause from the nonstop news cycle to look back on his groundbreaking career.

programme.title: Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home
programme.desc: The comic/social commentator performs at the Hudson Theatre, New York.

programme.title: Goodrich
programme.desc: Andy's life gets upended when his wife enters a 90-day rehab program, leaving him in charge of their twins. With his career falling by the wayside, he soon leans on his pregnant daughter for support, ultimately becoming the father she never had.

programme.title: Ellen DeGeneres: The Beginning
programme.desc: Comic Ellen DeGeneres performs. From the Beacon Theatre in New York.

programme.title: Nikki Glaser: Good Clean Filth
programme.desc: Nikki Glaser takes on a range of topics in her brutally honest yet conversational style, including dishing about sex, outlining the do's and don'ts of dating, how to trick someone into marriage and oversharing about her not-so-private parts.

programme.title: Whoopi Goldberg's Fontaine... Why Am I Straight
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg makes a 1988 solo appearance from somewhere in the frozen tundra of Alaska.

programme.title: Tracey Ullman in the Trailer Tales
programme.desc: Veteran makeup artist Ruby Romaine tries to get her job back after making a hasty decision to retire.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Unapologetic
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Lincoln Theatre in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: A young photographer uncovers a dark secret when he meets his girlfriend's seemingly friendly parents for the first time at their posh estate.

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: Dumped by her boyfriend, Emily persuades her mother, Linda, to accompany her on an exotic getaway to South America. The two polar opposites must quickly work through their differences to escape from a wildly outrageous and dangerous jungle adventure.

programme.title: Rosie O'Donnell: A Heartfelt Stand Up
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Levity Live Comedy Club in West Nyack, N.Y., delivering hilarious anecdotes about her family and details about the heart attack that changed her life.

programme.title: Atsuko Okatsuka: The Intruder
programme.desc: The comic-actor dishes on the futile art of impressing teenagers, attending a "Magic Mike Live" show with her grandmother, and the alarming reactions that she and her husband had to the unwanted presence of an intruder.

programme.title: The Man Who Invented Christmas

programme.title: Silver Linings Playbook

programme.title: The Big Year

programme.desc: The Instagram-perfect image of Brandy Melville hides a toxic work culture endemic to fast fashion, with discrimination against race, sex and body size.

programme.title: The Brink
programme.desc: Filmmaker Alison Klayman follows political strategist Stephen K. Bannon as he tries to mobilize and unify far-right parties during the 2018 U.S. midterm elections.

programme.title: Maggie
programme.desc: When a deadly zombie virus sweeps the nation, a father stops at nothing to save his infected daughter.

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: Hoping to stop a diabolical plot, the CIA implants the memories and skills of a dead agent (Ryan Reynolds) into the mind of a dangerous convict (Kevin Costner).

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: A group of scientists exploring the Marianas Trench encounter the largest marine predator that has ever existed the Megalodon.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: The Last House on the Left
programme.desc: After their daughter is assaulted and left for dead, a couple (Tony Goldwyn, Monica Potter) take revenge on the assailants, who have taken shelter at the couple's house.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: When members of a dance troupe are lured to an empty school, drug-laced sangria causes their jubilant rehearsal to descend into a dark and explosive nightmare as they try to survive the night -- and find out who's responsible -- before it's too late.

programme.title: War on Everyone
programme.desc: Two corrupt cops, who make money blackmailing criminals, come up against one who may be far more dangerous than both of them.

programme.title: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
programme.desc: San Francisco health inspectors (Donald Sutherland, Brooke Adams) find alien pods are taking over people as they sleep.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: When the Sun Sets
programme.desc: A young nurse fears her activist brother may be in danger in apartheid South Africa.

programme.title: The Snakes
programme.desc: A woman's violent fantasies spiral out of control when she joins a neighborhood watch group.

programme.title: Shadows
programme.desc: A high school student exploring her independence on homecoming night is disrupted by her older brother and the shadows of their past.

programme.title: Barbershop
